LookupFilter.name: LookupFilter
LookupFilter.description: Represents a lookup filter, which restricts the valid values and lookup dialog results for lookup, master-detail, and hierarchical relationship fields.

Active.description: If true, the lookup filter is active.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Record Type Name.

FullName.description: The full name of the associated metadata object in Metadata API.

IsOptional.description: Required. If true, the lookup filter is optional.

ManageableState.description: Indicates the manageable state of the specified component that is contained in a package: beta deleted deprecated deprecatedEditable installed installedEditable released unmanaged

Metadata.description: The metadata for this lookup filter.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace of the custom field, which is sometimes different from the object’s namespace.

SourceFieldDefinition.description: The field that this filter applies to.

SourceFieldDefinitionId.description: Durable ID of the object specified in SourceFieldDefinition.

SourceObject.description: The object that contains the lookup field that uses this lookup filter. Null if the lookup filter doesn’t reference fields on the source object.

TargetEntityDefinition.description: The entity definition for the source lookup field.
